What does 'I can assure you that' imply about one's beliefs?
When someone says, "I can assure you that," they are implying that there must be strong reasons for what they believe and that they trust their own understanding of the situation.

The rhetorical effect is that by commenting on how sure you are that something is true, you imply, without saying, that there must be very strong reasons for what you believe—assuming that the audience believes you are a reasonable person, of course.
